noun.description: A collectible object such as a piece of furniture or work of art that has a high value because of its considerable age.

adjective.description: (of a collectible object) having a high value because of considerable age.

verb.description: Make (something) resemble an antique by artificial means.
examples: sanding will change the luster of the sanded spot, especially if the finish has been antiqued
they went antiquing almost every weekend
I antiqued all day with my mother

origin: Late 15th century (as an adjective): from Latin antiquus, anticus former, ancient, from ante before.
